dialogue: Doctor: Does this area bother you when you touch it?
Patient: No, it doesn't really bother me when I touch it.
Doctor: Is there anything else like this on your body?
Patient: Yes, there is another one on my leg.
Doctor: How big is this lesion compared to your other moles or spots?
Patient: This lesion is significantly larger than any of my other moles or spots.
Doctor: Is the edge of this spot smooth or does it look uneven?
Patient: The edge of this spot looks uneven.
Doctor: Where exactly do you notice this lesion on your body?
Patient: I noticed this lesion on my left forearm.
Doctor: What color is the area around the lesion?
Patient: The area around the lesion is a lighter pink color, which contrasts with the darker pink of the lesion itself.
Doctor: Does the surface of the lesion feel different from the rest of your skin?

Patient: Yes, the surface of the lesion feels different from the rest of my skin. It has a rough texture and appears to be elevated, which contrasts with the smoother, more uniform texture of the surrounding skin.
Doctor: Do you notice any changes in how often you see this lesion?
Patient: Yes, I have noticed that this lesion appears more frequently than before.
